ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to analysis literature more effectively. I learned the importance of understanding historical context to literature. Read amazing and interesting books. Learned about analyzing the perspective literature is written from.

I learned how to write literature papers! This is the first intensive writing class I have taken at Yale, and I learned how to digest readings, pick out useful quotes, and write about them in one semester. I also became so much more informed about the Francophone West Indies.
I developed the ability to critically analyze complex texts, as well as the ability to understandably explain my ideas about a text to a group. I also refined my writing abilities.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: A little more guidance on the readings assigned

I really cannot think of any weaknesses. I loved that the class focuses on three main texts with shorter articles. This was preferred over some classes that I have taken that read a book/week because I feel like an expert in the books that we read, and I truly believe that we were able to do justice to the books. We also got a lot of insight/context from those articles that we read which made the reading experience much better.
I loved this course! I thought that the novels we discussed were super interesting, and Prof. Glover facilitated valuable discussions.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely! Amazing class! I enjoyed every class and felt like I learned so much! The professor is amazing. Best class taken at Yale!

100%. If I could go over that I would. Professor Glover such an impressive scholar and a very thoughtful, considerate mentor that I would recommend this course to anyone interested in the Francophone West Indies or simply a challenge.

Yes! This was one of my favorite courses I've taken at Yale. Prof. Glover made the novels come alive, giving social, political, and historical context for each book. This resulted in interesting discussions each week. She created a positive learning environment that encouraged a supportive atmosphere among students.
